# Rubric

- Approximately 30 pages long
- 

## Total Points (100 points)

### Abstract (10 points)

- 250 words only

### Introduction & Literature Review (25 points)

- Introduction should be on the purpose of the study
  - also have information on what your study is contributing to the field

- Literature Review is on existing literature on the topic to show you know what you're talking about
  - this should include all relationships that you are looking at
  - also includes the purpose of control variables
  
- research questions/hypotheses

### Method (15 points)

- Participants
  - tell me about the your sample
  - how did you recruit?

- Measures
  - what measures did you use
  - did you create a survey/questionnaire?

- Procedure & Design
  - paint me a picture of your design

- Data Analysis Plan
  - very similar to IRB protocol

### Results (15 points)

- preliminary results
  - descriptive statistics
  - analyses to help answer your research questions/hypotheses
  
- main analyses
  - what was in your IRB proposal

- exploratory analyses
  - anything else that you may be interested in answering
  - may be something that you originally didn't think of

### Discussion & Implications (25 points)

- Reinstate your purpose(s)

- discuss each finding
  - connect it with past literature

- what do your findings mean past your study?
  - what does this do for practitioners/researchers/plicy makers

### Figures & Tables ( points)

- need to have at least 1 figure and 1 table

### Formatting & References ( points)

- APA formatting (7th edition) for:
  - abstract formatting
  - headings and subheadings
  - citations
  - references
  - tables & figures
  - title page
  - header for each page and page number
